verses.kjv: In those days there was no king in Israel: and in those days the tribe of the Danites sought them an inheritance to dwell in; for unto that day all their inheritance had not fallen unto them among the tribes of Israel.
verses.ct: During that time, Israel had no king. The tribe of Dan was searching for territory to settle in, because they still hadn't received their full allotment of land among the tribes of Israel.

verses.kjv: And the children of Dan sent of their family five men from their coasts, men of valour, from Zorah, and from Eshtaol, to spy out the land, and to search it; and they said unto them, Go, search the land: who when they came to mount Ephraim, to the house of Micah, they lodged there.
verses.ct: So the people of Dan sent out 5 brave warriors from their clan, from Zorah and Eshtaol, to scout and explore the land. They told them, 'Go explore the land.' The men traveled to the hill country of Ephraim and arrived at Micah's house, where they spent the night.

verses.kjv: When they were by the house of Micah, they knew the voice of the young man the Levite: and they turned in thither, and said unto him, Who brought thee hither? and what makest thou in this place? and what hast thou here?
verses.ct: While they were near Micah's house, they recognized the young Levite's voice. They went over to him and asked, 'Who brought you here? What are you doing in this place? What's your role here?'

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Thus and thus dealeth Micah with me, and hath hired me, and I am his priest.
verses.ct: He told them, 'This is the arrangement Micah has with me — he hired me, and I serve as his priest.'

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Ask counsel, we pray thee, of God, that we may know whether our way which we go shall be prosperous.
verses.ct: They said to him, 'Please ask God whether the journey we're on will be successful.'

verses.kjv: And the priest said unto them, Go in peace: before the LORD is your way wherein ye go.
verses.ct: The priest told them, 'Go with confidence. The LORD is watching over your journey.'

verses.kjv: Then the five men departed, and came to Laish, and saw the people that were therein, how they dwelt careless, after the manner of the Zidonians, quiet and secure; and there was no magistrate in the land, that might put them to shame in any thing; and they were far from the Zidonians, and had no business with any man.
verses.ct: The 5 men left and arrived at Laish. They observed that the people living there were carefree, living in the style of the Sidonians — peaceful and unsuspecting. There was no ruling authority in the land to threaten them in any way. They were far from the Sidonians and had no alliances with anyone.

verses.kjv: And they came unto their brethren to Zorah and Eshtaol: and their brethren said unto them, What say ye?
verses.ct: They returned to their brothers at Zorah and Eshtaol, and their brothers asked them, 'What did you find?'

verses.kjv: And they said, Arise, that we may go up against them: for we have seen the land, and, behold, it is very good: and are ye still? be not slothful to go, and to enter to possess the land.
verses.ct: They answered, 'Let's go! We should attack them! We've seen the land, and it's excellent. Why are you just sitting here? Don't hesitate — go and take possession of the land!'

verses.kjv: When ye go, ye shall come unto a people secure, and to a large land: for God hath given it into your hands; a place where there is no want of any thing that is in the earth.
verses.ct: 'When you get there, you'll find an unsuspecting people and a spacious land. God has handed it over to you — a place that lacks nothing the earth has to offer.'

verses.kjv: And there went from thence of the family of the Danites, out of Zorah and out of Eshtaol, six hundred men appointed with weapons of war.
verses.ct: So 600 men from the clan of Dan, armed with weapons of war, set out from Zorah and Eshtaol.

verses.kjv: And they went up, and pitched in Kirjathjearim, in Judah: wherefore they called that place Mahanehdan unto this day: behold, it is behind Kirjathjearim.
verses.ct: They went up and set up camp at Kiriath-jearim in Judah. That is why that place has been called Mahaneh-dan to this day — it's west of Kiriath-jearim.

verses.kjv: And they passed thence unto mount Ephraim, and came unto the house of Micah.
verses.ct: From there they continued on to the hill country of Ephraim and came to Micah's house.

verses.kjv: Then answered the five men that went to spy out the country of Laish, and said unto their brethren, Do ye know that there is in these houses an ephod, and teraphim, and a graven image, and a molten image? now therefore consider what ye have to do.
verses.ct: Then the 5 men who had scouted the territory of Laish spoke up and told their brothers, 'Did you know that in these houses there's an ephod, household idols, a carved image, and a cast metal idol? Think about what you should do.'

verses.kjv: And they turned thitherward, and came to the house of the young man the Levite, even unto the house of Micah, and saluted him.
verses.ct: So they turned off the road and went to the house of the young Levite — Micah's house — and greeted him.

verses.kjv: And the six hundred men appointed with their weapons of war, which were of the children of Dan, stood by the entering of the gate.
verses.ct: The 600 armed Danite warriors positioned themselves at the entrance of the gate.

verses.kjv: And the five men that went to spy out the land went up, and came in thither, and took the graven image, and the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image: and the priest stood in the entering of the gate with the six hundred men that were appointed with weapons of war.
verses.ct: The 5 scouts went inside and took the carved image, the ephod, the household idols, and the cast metal idol, while the priest stood at the entrance of the gate with the 600 armed men.

verses.kjv: And these went into Micah’s house, and fetched the carved image, the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image. Then said the priest unto them, What do ye?
verses.ct: When the men entered Micah's house and took the carved image, the ephod, the household idols, and the cast metal idol, the priest asked them, 'What are you doing?'

verses.kjv: And they said unto him, Hold thy peace, lay thine hand upon thy mouth, and go with us, and be to us a father and a priest: is it better for thee to be a priest unto the house of one man, or that thou be a priest unto a tribe and a family in Israel?
verses.ct: They told him, 'Be quiet! Put your hand over your mouth and come with us. Be our priest and spiritual leader. Which is better for you — to be priest for one man's household, or to be priest for an entire tribe and clan in Israel?'

verses.kjv: And the priest’s heart was glad, and he took the ephod, and the teraphim, and the graven image, and went in the midst of the people.
verses.ct: This made the priest happy. He took the ephod, the household idols, and the carved image, and joined the group.

verses.kjv: So they turned and departed, and put the little ones and the cattle and the carriage before them.
verses.ct: They turned and left, placing the children, the livestock, and their possessions at the front of the group.

verses.kjv: And when they were a good way from the house of Micah, the men that were in the houses near to Micah’s house were gathered together, and overtook the children of Dan.
verses.ct: After they had traveled a good distance from Micah's house, the men who lived near Micah's home gathered together and caught up with the Danites.

verses.kjv: And they cried unto the children of Dan. And they turned their faces, and said unto Micah, What aileth thee, that thou comest with such a company?
verses.ct: They shouted after the Danites. The Danites turned around and said to Micah, 'What's your problem? Why did you bring this crowd?'

verses.kjv: And he said, Ye have taken away my gods which I made, and the priest, and ye are gone away: and what have I more? and what is this that ye say unto me, What aileth thee?
verses.ct: Micah replied, 'You've taken the gods I made and my priest, and you've left! What do I have left? How can you ask me, "What's your problem?"'

verses.kjv: And the children of Dan said unto him, Let not thy voice be heard among us, lest angry fellows run upon thee, and thou lose thy life, with the lives of thy household.
verses.ct: The Danites warned him, 'Don't let us hear another word from you, or some hot-tempered men among us might attack you, and you'll lose your life along with the lives of your family.'

verses.kjv: And the children of Dan went their way: and when Micah saw that they were too strong for him, he turned and went back unto his house.
verses.ct: The Danites continued on their way. When Micah realized they were too powerful for him, he turned around and went home.

verses.kjv: And they took the things which Micah had made, and the priest which he had, and came unto Laish, unto a people that were at quiet and secure: and they smote them with the edge of the sword, and burnt the city with fire.
verses.ct: So the Danites took what Micah had made and his priest, and they marched against Laish — a peaceful, unsuspecting people. They struck them down with the sword and burned the city to the ground.

verses.kjv: And there was no deliverer, because it was far from Zidon, and they had no business with any man; and it was in the valley that lieth by Bethrehob. And they built a city, and dwelt therein.
verses.ct: No one came to rescue them because they were far from Sidon and had no alliances with anyone. The city was in the valley near Beth-rehob. The Danites rebuilt the city and settled there.

verses.kjv: And they called the name of the city Dan, after the name of Dan their father, who was born unto Israel: howbeit the name of the city was Laish at the first.
verses.ct: They renamed the city Dan, after their ancestor Dan, who was a son of Israel. The city had originally been called Laish.

verses.kjv: And the children of Dan set up the graven image: and Jonathan, the son of Gershom, the son of Manasseh, he and his sons were priests to the tribe of Dan until the day of the captivity of the land.
verses.ct: The Danites set up the carved image for themselves. Jonathan son of Gershom, son of Manasseh, and his descendants served as priests for the tribe of Dan until the day the land went into captivity.

verses.kjv: And they set them up Micah’s graven image, which he made, all the time that the house of God was in Shiloh.
verses.ct: They kept Micah's carved image that he had made set up the entire time that the house of God was in Shiloh.
